name: South Kinsman Mountain

trails_config.name: Lonesome Lake & Fishin’ Jimmy
trails_config.description: Starting at the popular Lonesome Lake, ascend past the AMC hut and up the rocky Fishin’ Jimmy Trail. After reaching Kinsman Ridge, summit North Kinsman then continue to South Kinsman’s broad peak. The southern summit has an open rock perch with sweeping views over Moosilauke and the Franconia region. A challenging day that rewards with a peaceful, less-traveled summit.

current_conditions.ai_summary: Experience the beauty of New Hampshire on South Kinsman Mountain. At 4358 feet, this summit commands impressive views of the surrounding wilderness.
risk_factors: Check local trail conditions before departing.
Start early to avoid afternoon storms.

generated_description:
The Experience

Standing at 4358 feet, South Kinsman Mountain is a standout peak in New Hampshire. Known for its rugged and challenging terrain, it offers a quintessential hiking experience.

The Challenge

Hikers often choose the **Lonesome Lake & Fishin’ Jimmy**, a **12.0 mile** route gaining significant elevation. As part of the **NH48 4000-Footers**, it draws peak-baggers from across the region.

Peak Bagging Logic

**Peak Bagging Opportunity:** Consider connecting this hike with **North Kinsman Mountain**, which is just 2.0 miles away. Linking these peaks is a popular way to maximize your day on the trail.
